private_information: I focus on analyzing sequences of actions and mapping predicates to object roles in the first problem instance.
I may propose intermediate labels for objects and identify implicit dependencies between actions.
planner_a.goal: Produce a clear intermediate representation of the action definitions and the first statement and plan so they can be merged later.

private_information: I focus on analyzing the second problem instance and extracting preconditions, effects, and intended resource flows.
I avoid producing final PDDL but provide structured models, naming conventions, and identification of possible naming conflicts.
planner_b.goal: Produce a clear intermediate representation of the action definitions and the second statement and plan so they can be merged later.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency across partial models and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties.
I explicitly list required assumptions and eliminate shorthand that would hide causal dependencies.
auditor.goal: Detect and correct temporal or causal inconsistencies in the planners' intermediate representations and produce a consolidated audit report with explicit, non-shortcut assumptions.

private_information: I integrate partial models and audit corrections into a final PDDL domain and problem pair targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
I must keep agent actions distinct in the combined PDDL and ensure the model is executable by FastDownwards.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a validated PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that achieves the specified goals for both problem instances, integrating the planners' analyses and the auditor's corrections.

public_information: Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Each action takes several object arguments.
Predicates used in the domain include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, collect, spring, stupendous and others as referenced by the actions.
Action semantics summary in plain language: To perform paltry require hand O0 cats O1 texture O2 vase O0 O1 next O1 O2; paltry makes next O0 O2 true and vase O0 O1 false.
To perform sip require hand O0 cats O1 texture O2 next O0 O2 next O1 O2; sip makes vase O0 O1 true and next O0 O2 false.
To perform clip require hand O0 sneeze O1 texture O2 next O1 O2 next O0 O2; clip makes vase O0 O1 true and next O0 O2 false.
To perform wretched require sneeze O0 texture O1 texture O2 stupendous O3 next O0 O1 collect O1 O3 collect O2 O3; wretched makes next O0 O2 true and next O0 O1 false.
To perform memory require cats O0 spring O1 spring O2 next O0 O1; memory makes next O0 O2 true and next O0 O1 false.
To perform tightfisted require hand O0 sneeze O1 texture O2 next O1 O2 vase O0 O1; tightfisted makes next O0 O2 true and vase O0 O1 false.

First statement instance initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_5, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
First statement instance goal: next object_10 object_6 and next object_9 object_6.

First instance proposed plan for inspection: clip object_9 object_3 object_5; clip object_10 object_3 object_5; wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1; tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_6; tightfisted object_10 object_3 object_6.

Second statement instance initial facts: cats object_0 cats object_1 collect object_6 object_2 collect object_7 object_2 collect object_8 object_3 collect object_9 object_3 hand object_10 hand object_11 next object_0 object_8 next object_1 object_6 next object_10 object_6 next object_11 object_9 next object_4 object_6 next object_5 object_8 sneeze object_4 sneeze object_5 spring object_6 spring object_8 stupendous object_2 stupendous object_3 texture object_6 texture object_7 texture object_8 texture object_9.
Second statement instance goal: next object_10 object_7 and next object_11 object_8.
The domain must avoid implicit bookkeeping shortcuts. All causal effects must be explicit and auditors will flag and remove any shorthand assumptions.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analysis agent that inspects the domain-level English descriptions, initial facts, and the first plan. Your task is to extract a structured intermediate representation containing object sorts, predicate signatures, action parameter roles, explicit preconditions and explicit effects, and to note any naming conflicts or missing links. Do not emit final PDDL. Provide a machine-friendly intermediate model using consistent names.
analyze.prompt: You are planner_a. Consider the public domain information and the first statement block and plan. Provide a structured intermediate representation that lists objects with types where possible, each predicate signature, each action with named parameters, explicit preconditions and explicit add and delete effects, and any assumptions you make. Do not produce PDDL. If information is missing, list the missing facts instead of making unverifiable assumptions.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analysis agent that inspects the domain-level English descriptions, initial facts, and the second plan. Your task is to extract a structured intermediate representation containing object sorts, predicate signatures, action parameter roles, explicit preconditions and explicit effects, and to note any naming conflicts or missing links. Do not emit final PDDL. Provide a machine-friendly intermediate model using consistent names.
analyze.prompt: You are planner_b. Consider the public domain information and the second statement block and plan. Provide a structured intermediate representation that lists objects with types where possible, each predicate signature, each action with named parameters, explicit preconditions and explicit add and delete effects, and any assumptions you make. Do not produce PDDL. If information is missing, list the missing facts instead of making unverifiable assumptions.

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal auditor. Your role is to analyze the intermediate models from multiple planners, detect and correct temporal or causal inconsistencies, and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties. Produce an audit report that enumerates each detected issue, the recommended deterministic correction, any added predicates or ordering constraints required for clarity, and explicit assumptions that must be added to the model to make causal chains explicit.
audit.prompt: You are the auditor. Inspect the two intermediate representations provided by planner_a and planner_b. Identify any inconsistent predicate naming, ambiguous object roles, missing causal links, or uses of bookkeeping shortcuts. For each issue, propose a concrete fix so that actions express explicit causal effects without shortcuts. Output a consolidated corrected intermediate model and a change log of modifications and explicit assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in producing multi-agent PDDL domains and problems targeted to the FastDownwards planner. Your job is to integrate the planners' intermediate models and the auditor corrections into a single coherent PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files suitable for FastDownwards. Keep actions distinct where they originate from different agents, make all causal effects explicit, and ensure typing and predicate signatures are consistent. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Explicitly state FastDownwards compatibility considerations such as STRIPS subset, ADL usage, and type declarations.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the integrated intermediate representations and the audit report to create a PDDL domain and PDDL problem(s) that achieve the specified goals for both instances. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names or grouping with comments. Ensure all bookkeeping shortcuts identified by the auditor are removed and replaced with explicit predicates and ordering constraints. Produce a final PDDL domain and one problem file per statement instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver and note any solver-relevant choices you made.
